sailpoint.object

Class ProvisioningConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.ProvisioningConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject

    public class ProvisioningConfig
extends AbstractXmlObject
    A subcomponent of the Application model holding information related to provisioning.
    See Also:

      • getProvisioningRequestExpiration

        public int getProvisioningRequestExpiration()
        The number of days a ProvisioningRequest is allowed to live before it is considered expired. If this is zero, the expiration days are taken from the system configuration entry "provisioningRequestExpirationDays".

      • setProvisioningRequestExpiration

        public void setProvisioningRequestExpiration(int i)

      • isNoPermissions

        public boolean isNoPermissions()

      • setNoPermissions

        public void setNoPermissions(boolean b)

      • getPlanInitializer

        public Rule getPlanInitializer()
        A rule that is used to load arbitrary data in a ProvisioningPlan. This helps economize what data gets passed across to the integration, instead of sending lots of unneeded data (for example - loading just the name of the person being remediated, instead of passing the entire Identity object to the integration).

      • setPlanInitializer

        public void setPlanInitializer(Rule rule)

      • getPlanInitializerScript

        public Script getPlanInitializerScript()

      • setPlanInitializerScript

        public void setPlanInitializerScript(Script script)

        public DynamicValue getPlanInitializerLogic()
        Return a DynamicValue that can be used to evaluate the plan initializer.

      • getClusterScript

        public Script getClusterScript()

      • setClusterScript

        public void setClusterScript(Script script)

      • getManagedResources

        public java.util.List<ManagedResource> getManagedResources()
        List of resources that are managed by the target system. This is used to filter role sync and provisioning requests into requests that only involve resources on this list and also defines name transformations for the resource and its attributes.

      • setManagedResources

        public void setManagedResources(java.util.List<ManagedResource> resources)
